controller.description:
jQuery UI Controller Widget
A jQuery UI Widget that provides you clean and handy way to organize your jQuery code. Controllers organize event handlers through the power of event delegation. If something happens in your application, either it is browser event or custom ones, a controller should respond to it.
  • Controllers let you know where your code is!
  • Controllers force you to group events and label your html in specific ways.
  • Controllers are inheritable.
  • Controllers use event delegation.
controller.name: controller

table-controller.description:
Controller of main table page.
Deal with user interaction such as mouseover and row selection, so as to buttons binding.
table-controller.name: table-controller

$.ui.controller.name: $.ui.controller

constructors.description: Controller method. Setup instance in widget ones, init model and events.

_initEvents.description:
Setup event delegation restricted to the controller container.
Each eventHandler is given a context (thanks to $.proxy method) that matchs the correct instance. This means that you could use something 
like this.doThing() in there. The original or current target are still available in Event object passed in as parameter.

_initModel.description:
Init model by walking through hidden inputs within controller container 
and make it available to use via this.Model

_unbindEvents.description:
FIXME: TDB
Removes any event handlers fir this particular component.

_createInstance.description:
Internal use only. Does three things:
  • Extends the baseController and create a fresh a new instance.
  • Stores a reference of newly created instance in an internal controllers cache (with some metadata, namely used selector and base Class)
  • Setup error handling in controllers instance.
FIXME: Prevent multiple instantiation of same controller. Will have to check in cache first.

destroy.description:
Delegated destroy method from widget's prototype.
Remove any delegated event handlers, call the controller's destroy 
method and widget's super one.

params.name: name
params.description: Period separated list of namespaces to nest. MyClass.ns('foo.bar') makes MyClass['foo']['bar'].

params.name: value
params.description: Set the contents of the deepest specified namespace to this value.

$.ui.controller.description:
Widget implementation of controllers.
Does a few things:
  • At this point, controller instance is already created and provided by the proxy controller.
  • Init model by walking through hidden inputs in controller container and make it available to use via this.Model
  • Setup event delegation restricted to controller container.

ui.SandBox.name: ui.SandBox

getController.description: Allow you to retrieve a specific controller from the internal cache

ui.Class.name: ui.Class

extend.description: Extends a class with a new prototype.

ui.Class.description:
Based on jresig's implementaton (http://ejohn.org/blog/simple-javascript-inheritance/)
A base class which objects requiring oop implementation can extend. Class also handles the support of a _super method that allow you to override methods while keeping the ability to call overriden method somewhere in the process.
All subsequent controllers are inherited from BaseController which extends this Class.

ui.BaseController.name: ui.BaseController

constructors.description: BaseController constructor. Setup empty Model and Elements.

fire.description: Fire (Trigger) a custom event upon all registered controllers.

listen.description: Bind a custom event upon current instance.

ui.BaseController.description:
Base Controller Class. All subsequent controller will inherit this one.
Provides common interface for controllers communication.

wt.controller.LogMyRow.name: wt.controller.LogMyRow

constructors.description: Just for logging purpose. We make sure to call the super one.

wt.controller.LogMyRow.description: Just for fun. Here is a base class that TableController will extend.
